p: Compounds 303– 304 were evaluated for their antibacterial activities against six pathogenic bacteria including M. tetragenus, S. aureus, S. albus, B. cereus, B. subtilis, E. coli. Compound 303 showed antibacterial activity against E. coli with the MIC value of 6.25 μg/mL, and 304 exhibited a broad spectrum of antibacterial activities against six pathogenic with the MIC value ranging from 12.5 to 50 μg/mL (MIC values: 50 µg/mL for M. tetragenus, 25 µg/mL for S. aureus, >50 µg/mL for S. albus, 25 µg/mL for B. cereus, 12.5 µg/mL for B. subtilis and 50 µg/mL for E. coli). Ciprofloxacin was used as a positive control (MIC values: 0.313 µg/mL for M. tetragenus and S. aureus, 0.625 µg/mL for S. albus, B. cereus, B. subtilis and E. coli) [ 100].
